author: wddgit
body:
#### PR description:

Please let me know if you want me to approach this migration in a different way. I am not an expert on this area of the code and am open to suggestions.

This is part of an effort to finish the migration from ::JetCorrector to reco::JetCorrector that started in 2014, ::JetCorrector has been deprecated since then. This is related to calling consumes for data that we need to get. The goal is to delete the header JetMETCorrections/Objects/interface/JetCorrector.h in the near future. 

The approach in the current version of this PR deletes all the relevant files. I am proposing this approach because I noticed the following:

- These test modules are old (years) and there is no recent development other than generic maintenance
- The files deleted by this PR are the only files in CMSSW that reference the two modules that are deleted.
- There are no tests that run in the IBs for these modules.
- The test configurations deleted have input that is very old
- I have some suspicions that the deleted configurations would fail for other reasons.

Some other alternatives:

- Spend the development time and effort to migrate the modules to use reco::JetCorrector instead of ::JetCorrector. If these modules are important, I could try to do this if it does not take too long.
- Comment out the JetCorrector part, add an assert that will cause it to obviously fail, and add a comment that someone needs to fix this in the future. It could be fixed if and when someone needs it or a Calibration expert could take care of it when it is convenient.
- If a Calibration expert is available and has the time to deal with this soon, then I'd be happy to close this PR and let that expert take care of this.
- Something else. I am open to suggestions.

#### PR validation:

Nothing uses this other than the test configurations which are also deleted. I do not think there are any tests in CMSSW that run the deleted modules.

FYI @makortel @Dr15Jones
title: JetCorrector migration, Calibration/HcalCalibAlgos
